title: Level 5 Space Practice Test
description: Test your skills with symmetry, enlargement, coordinates, and nets of 3D shapes at the Level 5 standard.

questions.question: What is the order of rotational symmetry of an equilateral triangle?
questions.explanation: An equilateral triangle looks the same after rotations of $120°$, $240°$, and $360°$. That's $3$ times, so the order is $3$.

questions.question: A shape has sides of $3 \text{ cm}$, $5 \text{ cm}$, and $7 \text{ cm}$. It is enlarged by a scale factor of $4$. What is the longest side of the enlarged shape?
questions.explanation: The longest side is $7 \text{ cm}$. Multiply by the scale factor: $7 \times 4 = 28 \text{ cm}$.

questions.question: What are the coordinates of a point that is $4$ units to the right and $6$ units up from the origin?
questions.explanation: Coordinates are written as $(x, y)$: $x$ = across = $4$, $y$ = up = $6$. The point is $(4, 6)$.

questions.question: A net consists of $6$ identical squares. What 3D shape does it fold into?
questions.explanation: A cube has $6$ square faces, all the same size. A net of $6$ identical squares folds into a cube.

questions.question: A rectangle is reduced by a scale factor of $\frac{1}{3}$. If the original length was $15 \text{ cm}$, what is the new length?
questions.explanation: Scale factor $\frac{1}{3}$ means each length becomes one-third: $15 \times \frac{1}{3} = 5 \text{ cm}$.

questions.question: How many faces does a triangular prism have?
questions.explanation: A triangular prism has $2$ triangular ends and $3$ rectangular sides = $5$ faces in total.

questions.question: A point is at $(3, 5)$. It moves $4$ units to the right and $2$ units down. What are the new coordinates? Write as (x, y).
questions.explanation: Moving right adds to $x$: $3 + 4 = 7$. Moving down subtracts from $y$: $5 - 2 = 3$. New coordinates: $(7, 3)$.

questions.question: What is the order of rotational symmetry of a regular hexagon?
questions.explanation: A regular hexagon has $6$ equal sides and looks the same every $\frac{360°}{6} = 60°$ of rotation. It has rotational symmetry of order $6$.

questions.question: A square-based pyramid has $1$ square base and $4$ triangular faces. How many edges does it have?
questions.explanation: The square base has $4$ edges. Each of the $4$ triangular faces adds $1$ sloping edge from a base corner to the apex. Total: $4 + 4 = 8$ edges.

questions.question: A photo is $10 \text{ cm}$ wide and $15 \text{ cm}$ tall. It is enlarged by a scale factor of $2$. What is the area of the enlarged photo in $\text{cm}^2$?
questions.explanation: New dimensions: $10 \times 2 = 20 \text{ cm}$ wide and $15 \times 2 = 30 \text{ cm}$ tall. Area $= 20 \times 30 = 600 \text{ cm}^2$.
